qas.question: When did Mexicantown start to grow?
What was it called when many Mexican's were forcibly repatriated?

context: Detroit has a Mexican-American population. In the early 20th century thousands of Mexicans came to Detroit to work in agricultural, automotive, and steel jobs. During the <a3_0>Mexican Repatriation of the 1930s<a3_0/> many Mexicans in Detroit were willingly repatriated or forced to repatriate. By the <a0_0>1940s<a0_0/> the Mexican community began to settle what is now Mexicantown. The population significantly increased in the 1990s due to immigration from Jalisco. In 2010 Detroit had <a1_0>48,679<a1_0/> Hispanics, including <a2_0>36,452<a2_0/> Mexicans. The number of Hispanics was a 70% increase from the number in 1990.
